text: Georg von Békésy (3 June 1899 – 13 June 1972) was an Hungarian biophysicist. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1961 for his findings on the function of the cochlea in the mammalian inner ear. He was born in Budapest, Hungary and died in Honolulu, Hawaii, United States. ==References== Category:1899 births Category:1972 deaths Category:Autobiographers Category:Scientists from Budapest Category:Hungarian Nobel Prize winners Category:Biophysicists Category:Hungarian physicists
title: Georg von Békésy
